text: Highnote is an embedded finance platform
in the payments business

and we really provide
payment solutions to all
of our subscribers in ways
that are truly unique and innovative.

One of the challenges that
faces any payments platform is
really how to get connectivity to some
of these legacy solutions.

And with our partnership
with Visa and AWS,
being fully cloud-enabled,

Highnote is able to
connect our cloud platform
with Visa's and AWS,

which then streamlines the
entire transaction processing
scenario and allows our customers
to get up and running quickly.
And that's the name of the game.

- Highnote is connected
to Visa Cloud Connect
for their endpoint connection

and so they're able to process
transactions through VisaNet,

through their cloud
connection, which enabled them
to get live with VisaNet faster

and to go to market
with anything from four
to six months instead of nine.

Running on AWS allows Visa
endpoints to be connected

to from the cloud rather
than a traditional hardware
or physical connection.
So it's allowed our partners

to really scale up much
more quickly, efficiently,
and have a lot of cost savings.
Highnote can handle a higher volume

of transactions without
compromising on performance at all.

- Before Cloud Connect
was available, it took 12

to 18 months to integrate
and certify to Visa.
Now it takes four to six months
with a platform like Highnote

and sometimes even shorter,
that opens up a whole world
of possibilities for our customers

who want to process not
only in the US but globally.

And because we have this
connection in the cloud,

it really opens up major,
major opportunities

through that innovation
and we're really excited.

We wouldn't have been able
to do what we're doing

for our customers without
Visa Cloud Connect
and without the partnership with AWS.
